summary:
Chief Financial Officer with a 18-year experience in all aspects of business financial management (Financial Planning & Analysis, multicultural team management, Commercial business partnering) and Corporate Finance (LBO, M&A, venture capital, fundraising) with a strong focus on cash generation and/or preservation.
•	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with all stakeholders (Shareholders, other Executive Members, Finance teams, bank partners and auditors)
•	Self-motivated person with strong leadership qualities
•	High level of problem-solving skills and analytical mindset
•	Ability to work in a cash-sensitive environment (CFO under LBO)
•	Strong business acumen
•	Well developed organizational and time management skills
•	Good working knowledge of accounting standards (IFRS)

I joined Deloitte in 2006 in the audit practice. I managed the international coordination for the audit of EDF Group consolidated financial statements. I also conducted several assignments for clients of automotive and building materials industries.

As a Senior Manager in the Deloitte Financial Advisory department (Paris office) from 2010 to 2015, I operated:
 - Financial due diligences for major private equity funds or large companies and 
 - Restructuring advisory assignments for under-performing companies and lenders committees (automotive and aircraft industries).

I have been appointed CFO for AD Industries, a Group specialized in Aerospace industry in January 2016. I strongly focused on improving the quality of financial information as well as being a business partner for Business Dev, HR and operations. As an Exco member with the direct supervision of 15 people, being exemplary and fully committed were the two cornerstones of my leadership.  
I joined Deloitte Southeast Asia to serve as a Director Merger & Acquisitions early 2019 before being appointed Group CFO at Incomlend in January 2020. Despite Covid-19 outbreak, Incomlend succeeded in closing a c.USD20m Series A fundraising and issued USD7m convertible notes.

In May 2021, I have been appointed Group CFO for LYS Energy Group, a Singapore-based Solar IPP that builds, owns and operates Solar PV Systems for C&I and Public sites in APAC. The Group has been taken over by Leader Energy, Malaysian Group specialized in Power projects with a footprint in Asia.

Early 2023, I have decided to continue my family and professional project in Amsterdam. My goal is to integrate the financial department of an ambitious group with an international footprint.

profile_positions.description:
LYS Energy is a Singapore-based Solar Independent Power Producer (IPP) that builds, owns and operates Solar PV Systems for Commercial, Industrial and Public sites in the Asia Pacific region.
As a council member of the Sustainable Energy Association of Singapore (SEAS), the Group also acts as a consulting body with several government agencies in electricity and power sector.
LYS Energy aims at being a vector of the Energy Transition towards a more distributed, autonomous and smart model. Incorporating distributed generating facilities, energy storage systems and smart grid, the company re-invents the energy industry towards a customer-centric prosumer era.
Since its incorporation, the Group has deployed over 50MWp of high-performance solar PV systems, with a pipeline of over 200MWp in Singapore and across the region in Vietnam, Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and Philippines.
